7e00fb47-db69-40dc-96f4-138c049f81b7.description: The holder of this badge has engaged in a series of coursework related to higher education student advising and counseling. The holder understands and can support the psychological, academic, and professional needs of diverse undergraduate students.
7e00fb47-db69-40dc-96f4-138c049f81b7.name: Student Advising & Counseling

issuer.summary: issued by Stony Brook University School of Professional Development

entity.name: Stony Brook University School of Professional Development

badge_template_activities.title: Earn at least a 3.0 GPA in HEA 520 Advising and Counseling.

Earn at least a 3.0 GPA in two of the following courses: HEA 521 Diversity and Higher Education; HEA 522 Crisis Management and Prevention in Higher Education; HEA 525 The Contemporary Undergraduate; or HEA 526 Career Counseling and the Psychology of Work.

9a491c27-7f98-443b-aa34-a6a2ab8a0daf.description: The holder of this badge has engaged in a series of workshops related to the Core Competencies of Office for Persons with Developmental Disabilities (OPWDD). The earner puts people first, builds and maintains positive relationships, demonstrates professionalism, and is a change agent in their community.
9a491c27-7f98-443b-aa34-a6a2ab8a0daf.name: Community Residence Leadership in Supervision

issuer.summary: issued by Stony Brook University School of Professional Development

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully complete four 3-hour leadership workshops designed specifically for supervisors of direct service providers.

67f85cc4-c528-4bb6-9558-accb0c03bc48.description: The holder of this micro-credential obtained a foundational level of understanding of the concepts of quantum communications, simulation for basic science, quantum computing, quantum materials for QIS, and quantum-ready workforce by completing a 15-hour program that was led by subject-matter experts and industry representatives.
67f85cc4-c528-4bb6-9558-accb0c03bc48.name: International Quantum Summer Summit

issuer.summary: issued by Stony Brook University School of Professional Development

entity.name: Stony Brook University School of Professional Development

badge_template_activities.title: Credential holder participating in an online 15-hour program that was led by subject-matter experts and industry representatives.

81a74bf8-0c65-4b04-8e1a-4706a5342610.description: The holder of this micro-credential obtained a foundational level of understanding of the concepts of energy policy, power systems, aerodynamics, climate change, environmental and coastal implications, supply chain management, financing, value proposition, and coexistence by completing a 45-hour program that was led by subject-matter experts and industry representatives.
81a74bf8-0c65-4b04-8e1a-4706a5342610.name: Fundamentals of Offshore Wind

issuer.summary: issued by Stony Brook University School of Professional Development

entity.name: Stony Brook University School of Professional Development

badge_template_activities.title: The holder of this micro-credential participated in a three-week, 45-hour online program.

31ec6c19-5e9a-47e2-9d66-b630ed4c4038.description: The holder of this badge has engaged in a series of coursework related to employee relations. The holder understands Human Resources fundamentals and is familiar with employment law and policies, and is prepared to demonstrate best practices in employee relations and labor management.
31ec6c19-5e9a-47e2-9d66-b630ed4c4038.name: Employee Relations

issuer.summary: issued by Stony Brook University School of Professional Development

entity.name: Stony Brook University School of Professional Development

badge_template_activities.title: Earn at least a 3.0 GPA in the following courses: HRM 532 Foundations of Human Resources; HRM 533 Employee Relations and Labor Management; and HRM 545 Employment Law and Policy.
Students who are not in the HRM AGC or MS program need consent of the HRM program director to register.

e7df1abf-9ddd-49e9-bc3b-02d0b8754fe8.description: The holder of this badge has engaged in a series of coursework related to organizational development and performance management. The holder understands organizational theory, change management processes, and workforce development best practices.
e7df1abf-9ddd-49e9-bc3b-02d0b8754fe8.name: Organizational Development

issuer.summary: issued by Stony Brook University School of Professional Development

entity.name: Stony Brook University School of Professional Development

badge_template_activities.title: Earn at least a 3.0 GPA in HRM 538 Organizational Development and Change Management and HRM 547 Organizational Performance Management.
Earn at least a 3.0 GPA in EITHER HRM 541 Human Relations and Workforce Planning OR HRM 537 Employee Learning & Professional/Career Development.
Students who are not in the HRM AGC or MS program need consent of the HRM program director to register.

a15628fa-2602-44fe-a22c-953bec5b59c8.description: This nine-credit knowledge-based academic microcredential in Student Advising and Counseling in Higher Education provides individuals with an introduction to the theory and practice associated with advisement and counseling in higher education. It allows for additional emphasis in key areas including diversity, nontraditional student groups, and career counseling.
a15628fa-2602-44fe-a22c-953bec5b59c8.name: Student Advising and Counseling in Higher Education

issuer.summary: issued by Stony Brook University School of Professional Development

entity.name: Stony Brook University School of Professional Development

badge_template_activities.title: To earn this microcredential, students must take this course: HEA 520 Advising and Counseling. Students must also take two of the following courses: HEA 521 Diversity in Higher Education; HEA 525 The Contemporary Undergraduate; HEA 526 Career Counseling and the Psychology of Work; HEA 586 Practicum in Higher Education (The practicum is required in place of an elective for enrollees with less than one year of work experience in advising and/or counseling).

af498d36-f4dd-4c8b-9c91-6756b7d8bb59.description: The American Culture, Traditions, and Trends digital badge demonstrates that students have successfully completed the three-week non-credit experiential study abroad course focusing on contemporary American culture and trending societal issues.

badge_template_activities.title: Students will have demonstrated participation in classroom discussions and cultural activities and field trips, completion of readings, assignments, projects, and oral presentations.

2700fdbc-88d3-4ecf-b491-b4d7c5379f3d.description: By earning the University Badge in Higher Education Management & Operations, the holder has developed an in-depth understanding of issues in the organization and functioning of various departments in a higher education context. This badge is offered and maintained by Stony Brook University's highly-acclaimed graduate program in Higher Education Administration.
2700fdbc-88d3-4ecf-b491-b4d7c5379f3d.name: Higher Education Management & Operations

issuer.summary: issued by Stony Brook University School of Professional Development

Earn at least a 3.0 GPA in two of the following courses: HEA 524 Enrollment Management; HEA 531 Finance Issues in Higher Education; or HEA 532 Faciliities Management in Higher Education.

5081e40e-195d-4d45-af89-c1443a37b44c.description: The holder of this badge has participated in a workshop related to design thinking, a human-centered way of thinking optimized for innovation. The badge holder embraces empathy, creativity, and experimentation to create solutions that meet the needs of the audience for which they are designing. The holder employs innovative and effective brainstorming, prototyping, and testing techniques to help solve complex problems and develop new ideas.
5081e40e-195d-4d45-af89-c1443a37b44c.name: Design Thinking Workshop

issuer.summary: issued by Stony Brook University School of Professional Development

entity.name: Stony Brook University School of Professional Development

dee88e72-0e63-4d12-8921-71a66a78cdc6.description: Earners of this academic micro-credential can integrate educational technology tools and applications via best practices to support all types of learners. They have developed multiple techniques and strategies essential for balancing wellness, mindfulness, and technology into K-12 classroom curriculum.
dee88e72-0e63-4d12-8921-71a66a78cdc6.name: Teaching and Learning Online

issuer.summary: issued by Stony Brook University School of Professional Development

entity.name: Stony Brook University School of Professional Development

badge_template_activities.title: The earner of this badge has completed the requirements for two graduate courses – EDT 544 Empowering All Learners Through Educational Technology and EDT 541 Digital Wellness and Education

728da62e-11b0-47b6-8477-55b1a3a3cc6e.description: The badge earner is a Suffolk County School Superintendents Association member and school district leader who has successfully completed a comprehensive professional development program administered by the School of Professional Development, SCOPE Education Services and Suffolk County School Superintendents Association.

ebdd3d3f-bd5e-4641-83dc-c41cc9676638.description: Earners of this academic micro-credential have developed advanced knowledge of Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics (STEAM) to enhance K-12 pedagogy through inquiry, problem-based learning, design thinking, and creativity in instruction.
ebdd3d3f-bd5e-4641-83dc-c41cc9676638.name: STEAM Education

issuer.summary: issued by Stony Brook University School of Professional Development

entity.name: Stony Brook University School of Professional Development

badge_template_activities.title: The badge earner has completed three graduate courses in STEAM education for a total of 9 graduate credits: EDT 531 STEAM Education: Foundations; EDT 532 STEAM Education: Educational Best Practices; and EDT 533 STEAM Education: Curriculum Integration.

d5bf5957-66ff-4bed-9ac8-d07692363edb.description: The badge earner has demonstrated an ability to use specific educational tools, systems, apps, and resources for the K-12 classroom. The earner can design and develop curriculum and student-centered activities that promote communication and collaboration between students, including a plan to integrate technology tools and provide support through professional development. The earner can conduct training sessions to promote the success of all educators, students, and the larger community.
d5bf5957-66ff-4bed-9ac8-d07692363edb.name: Apps Master

issuer.summary: issued by Stony Brook University School of Professional Development

entity.name: Stony Brook University School of Professional Development

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the following 3-credit courses with a minimum of a 3.0 GPA: EST 525 Google Apps for Education Certified Trainer: Foundations; EST 526 Google Apps for Education Certified Trainer: Curriculum Integration; and EST 527 The Impact of Mobile Devices and Cloud Based Systems in Education.

a004ddda-515a-4dcc-a83a-1bc0dc9d8e60.description: This nine-credit knowledge-based academic micro-credential in Leadership in Higher Education Management and Operations provides individuals with an introduction to the theory and practice associated with leadership in higher education. It allows for additional emphasis in key areas including enrollment management, finance, and facilities management.
a004ddda-515a-4dcc-a83a-1bc0dc9d8e60.name: Leadership in Higher Education Management and Operations

issuer.summary: issued by Stony Brook University School of Professional Development

entity.name: Stony Brook University School of Professional Development

badge_template_activities.title: To earn this microcredential, students must take this course: HEA 503 Leadership in Higher Education. Students must also take two of the following: HEA 524 Enrollment Management; HEA 531 Finance Issues in Higher Education; HEA 532 Facilities Management in Higher Education

47cd34f5-6cc8-4cd4-9cb2-92f29abca7eb.description: Introduction to the Science and Lived Experience of Autism (ISLEA) training focuses on the clinical presentation, current scientific knowledge, and lived experiences of those on the autism spectrum. ISLEA training program participants gain basic knowledge of autism and experience an opportunity to critically consider current research and approaches on the needs, complexities, strengths, and experiences of this population.
47cd34f5-6cc8-4cd4-9cb2-92f29abca7eb.name: Introduction to the Science and Lived Experience of Autism

issuer.summary: issued by Stony Brook University School of Professional Development

entity.name: Stony Brook University School of Professional Development

badge_template_activities.title: Upon completion of the training, participants will be able to: 1. Identify core features and individual differences in autism; 2. Articulate key findings in autism science, including empirical findings and debunked myths; 3. Explain how consideration of the lived experience of autism leads to more humane and effective professional practice

b02a790b-8124-4f0b-8cab-3ada06fe3d7f.description: Badge earners can demonstrate foundational skills and knowledge required for effective professional action. Earners exhibit strong social skills, respect cultural differences, and can communicate effectively. Earners apply critical thinking and recognize the importance of behaving ethically across professional contexts. They adhere to professional s tandards and regulatory compliance, exhibit financial literacy, and can use technology and an innovative mindset to solve professional problems.
b02a790b-8124-4f0b-8cab-3ada06fe3d7f.name: Foundations of Professionalism

issuer.summary: issued by Stony Brook University School of Professional Development

entity.name: Stony Brook University School of Professional Development

badge_template_activities.title: Earn at least a 3.0 GPA in the following courses: LSF 501 Effective Professional Communication; LSF 502 Effective Professional Thinking; LSF 503 Effective Professional Global & Cultural Awareness; and LSF 504 Effective Professional Action & Leadership.

0b9124f7-368f-4734-ace6-a587ea481969.description: The holder of this badge is able to create, share, edit and delete invitations, calendar events and tasks using Google Calendar.

83c39720-1c54-4084-b061-d1070405a204.description: The holder of this badge can create narrated PPT slides and upload to YouTube to present to students. They are also able to embed these Blackboard LMS, for exams, and Google forms.

entity.name: Stony Brook University School of Professional Development

e03b10f0-9b85-4770-a40c-d3ab763afa78.description: The earner of this badge has demonstrated food literacy. The earner can help individuals make good food choices, understand accurate terminology when explaining basic nutritional guidelines and food types and promote healthy living by purchasing and cooking meals that are healthy and appropriate to individuals' dietary and medical/feeding needs.
e03b10f0-9b85-4770-a40c-d3ab763afa78.name: Community Residence Food Literacy

issuer.summary: issued by Stony Brook University School of Professional Development

entity.name: Stony Brook University School of Professional Development

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully complete three 3-hour workshops on Food Literacy through Stony Brook University. This program was developed in cooperation with the Stony Brook Southampton Food Lab.

e29977de-a76b-4542-bcdc-c4612770125c.description: The holder of this badge can build and deploy a basic android app utilizing visual block based code. The holder can create a standards based lesson in mobile app development that is relevant to the needs of students in the K-12 classroom and can scaffold instruction in mobile app development for a diverse range of learners.
e29977de-a76b-4542-bcdc-c4612770125c.name: Mobile Apps Pedagogy

issuer.summary: issued by Stony Brook University School of Professional Development

entity.name: Stony Brook University School of Professional Development

badge_template_activities.title: Complete 3-week course introducing K-12 teachers to the basics of android app development using visual block based coding. Emphasis is placed on a differentiated approach to mobile app development that is standards based and discipline specific.
Create a prototype app for curricular or co-curricular use with students.

ad7e8a1d-e92c-4e31-b307-1011e0b2f90c.description: This nine-credit knowledge-based academic micro-credential in Student Affairs Administration provides individuals with an introduction to the theory and practice associated with student affairs at colleges and universities. It allows for additional emphasis in key areas including crisis management, legal issues, and focused student groups (like first year students).
ad7e8a1d-e92c-4e31-b307-1011e0b2f90c.name: Student Affairs Administration

issuer.summary: issued by Stony Brook University School of Professional Development

entity.name: Stony Brook University School of Professional Development

badge_template_activities.title: To earn this microcredential, students must take these two courses: HEA 523 Student Affairs Administration and HEA 522 Legal Issues in Higher Education. Students must also take one of the following: HEA 530 Crisis Management and Prevention in Higher Education; HEA 533 Finance Issues in Higher Education; HEA 540 Critical Issues in Higher Education: First Year Focus.

821c17ec-3a63-4972-9f16-2623021a8406.description: The holder of this badge has engaged in a series of coursework related to athletic education. The holder understands the philosophy, principles and organization of athletic education, can apply health sciences to coaching, can prevent and treat athletic injuries, and can apply best practices in coaching techniques in a specific sport.
821c17ec-3a63-4972-9f16-2623021a8406.name: Coaching

issuer.summary: issued by Stony Brook University School of Professional Development

entity.name: Stony Brook University School of Professional Development

badge_template_activities.title: Earn at least a 3.0 GPA in the following courses: CEP 507 Philosophy, Principles and Organization of Athletics Education; CEP 513 Health Sciences Applied to Coaching: Care & Prevention of Athletic Injuries; and CEP 520 Theory and Techniques of Coaching: Sport-Specific Practicum (prerequisite: CEP 507).

8bf2326b-dcbf-4fbf-815a-1388d5d3b6ab.description: The holder of this badge can narrate, draw, and add questions to PPT slides using Office Mix. This earner can create accessible videos from any device and review analytics to see how long students view.

issuer.summary: issued by Stony Brook University School of Professional Development

bdc06758-b81d-4ef3-9419-b24d626ae4b1.description: The holder of this badge understands the role of navigators in healthcare. The badge holder can describe the social determinants of health, recognize factors contributing to health disparities, apply principles of cultural competency in the navigator role, and recognize protected healthcare information and describe strategies for maintaining HIPAA compliance. The earner understands cultural competency, health literacy, and approaches for mitigating health disparities.
bdc06758-b81d-4ef3-9419-b24d626ae4b1.name: Patient Navigation

issuer.summary: issued by Stony Brook University School of Professional Development

entity.name: Stony Brook University School of Professional Development

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully complete a four-week course designed to mirror the experience of a Patient Navigator. A key component of the course is introduction of basic navigation skills, assimilation of these skills, and reflection upon the prospective application of these skills in the healthcare setting.

ab1a648a-3dbb-46a7-bdfc-eae286e12b63.description: This nine-credit knowledge-based academic microcredential in Student Development, Technology, and Distance Learning in Higher Education provides individuals with an introduction to the theory and practice associated with student development and emphasizes the role of technology as well as the foundations of online learning.
ab1a648a-3dbb-46a7-bdfc-eae286e12b63.name: Student Development, Technology, and Distance Learning in Higher Education

issuer.summary: issued by Stony Brook University School of Professional Development

entity.name: Stony Brook University School of Professional Development

badge_template_activities.title: To earn this microcredential, students must take all of these courses: HEA 502 Survey of Student Development Theory; HEA 510 Technology in Higher Education; HEA 540 Critical Issues: Foundations of Online Education.

8d778d65-1237-4cb9-9907-ae412fa516e5.description: The holder of this badge recognizes strategies for teaching and learning using technologies and can intergrate these technologies into their curriculum.

98894a48-398e-438d-bac9-401203050fd0.description: This nine-credit knowledge-based academic micro-credential in Athletics Administration in Higher Education provides individuals with an introduction to the theory and practice associated with athletic administration in higher education. It allows for emphasis in key areas including the management and organization of intercollegiate athletics, education and development of college-student athletes, and the integration of athletics within the higher education context.
98894a48-398e-438d-bac9-401203050fd0.name: Athletics Administration in Higher Education

badge_template_activities.title: To earn this microcredential, students must take these courses: HEA 533 Inter-Collegiate Athletics; CEP 507 Philosophy, Principles, and Organization of Athletics in Education. Students must also take one of the following courses: HEA 532 Facilities Management in Higher Education; HEA 540 Critical Issues: College Student Wellness.

49da205b-8990-4c5f-b0b1-fd11112b44ad.description: The holder of this badge has engaged in a series of coursework related to educational technology curriculum design.

Varied levels of intercollegiate athletics specifically related to coaching are included in the course content. This allows for additional emphasis in key areas including NCAA Divisions, multiple sports, and gender-specific programs.
c6897fa5-346f-4fd8-8708-4cdfa6753d40.name: Coaching in Athletics in Higher Education

entity.name: Stony Brook University School of Professional Development

badge_template_activities.title: To earn this microcredential, students must take all of these courses: HEA 533 Inter-Collegiate Athletics; CEP 502 Principles of Coaching; CEP 520 Theory and Techniques of Coaching: Sport-Specific Practicum.

10fdb2f8-70ee-4e50-99a5-2cf4ced38ede.description: The holder of this badge has engaged in a series of coursework related to Contemporary Asia and Asian American Studies. This Badge is offered in coordination with the Department of Asia and Asian American Studies at Stony Brook University.
10fdb2f8-70ee-4e50-99a5-2cf4ced38ede.name: Contemporary Asia and Asian American Studies

issuer.summary: issued by Stony Brook University School of Professional Development

entity.name: Stony Brook University School of Professional Development

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully complete any two of the following courses: AAS 560/CEJ 503 Empire, Memory and Narratives of Asian America; AAS 575CEJ 505 Multilingualism & Communication in Asia; or AAS 571/CEJ 504 Islamic Thought in Asia.

6b946011-d71b-4a26-be4e-f63ec8e9314a.description: The holder of this badge has engaged in a series of coursework related to corporate financial management. The holder is familiar with merger & acquisition processes and is equipped with the knowledge to effectively manage corporate finances.
6b946011-d71b-4a26-be4e-f63ec8e9314a.name: Corporate Financial Management

issuer.summary: issued by Stony Brook University School of Professional Development

entity.name: Stony Brook University School of Professional Development

badge_template_activities.title: Earn at least a 3.0 GPA in FIN 552 Mergers & Acquisitions and FIN 536 Financial Management.
Students who are not in the Finance AGC or MBA program need consent of the Finance program director to register.

8d13c4e0-dc85-42ff-8197-9bd7f2b9c014.description: The holder of this badge has participated in a seminar related to design thinking, a human-centered way of thinking optimized for innovation. The badge holder understands the philosophy of Design Thinking, is able to name and explain the five parts of the Design Thinking process, and has experienced activities that require collaboration, empathy, and innovation.
8d13c4e0-dc85-42ff-8197-9bd7f2b9c014.name: Design Thinking Fundamentals

issuer.summary: issued by Stony Brook University School of Professional Development

entity.name: Stony Brook University School of Professional Development

badge_template_activities.title: Complete 2.5 hour overview of Design Thinking

3d324bc9-57c0-455a-aab7-987d3963999d.description: The holder of this badge has engaged in a series of coursework related to diverse literatures. The earner can design curriculum incorporating literature that represents a wide range of experiences and historical events, and can foster productive dialogue around the literary content.
3d324bc9-57c0-455a-aab7-987d3963999d.name: Diverse Literatures

issuer.summary: issued by Stony Brook University School of Professional Development

entity.name: Stony Brook University School of Professional Development

badge_template_activities.title: Earn at least a 3.0 GPA in the following courses: CEG 537 The Immigration Experience in Literature; CEV 542 Surviving the Holocaust: Literature; CEI 518 Literature of American Slavery; and AFH 528: Contemporary Black Literature and Cultural Criticism.

35a8767e-7f38-4a11-9434-159fcd459c9c.description: The holder of this badge has engaged in a series of coursework related to education technology.
35a8767e-7f38-4a11-9434-159fcd459c9c.name: Educational Technology Expert

issuer.summary: issued by Stony Brook University School of Professional Development

entity.name: Stony Brook University School of Professional Development

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the  Educational Technology Expert workshop.

7dd151f6-7baf-4e6a-a9f9-6bb74df62cec.description: The holder of this badge can use IVQ in order to add timed multiple choice or "hangman" questions to videos used in instruction and question stats on student views.
7dd151f6-7baf-4e6a-a9f9-6bb74df62cec.name: Interactive Video Quiz (IVQ)

issuer.summary: issued by Stony Brook University School of Professional Development

entity.name: Stony Brook University School of Professional Development

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Interactive Video Quiz (IVQ) workshop.

1d9472c2-07f3-4193-b8f8-74b49e195345.description: The holder of this badge can build and deploy a front-facing website utilizing HTML, CSS, and Javascript. The holder can create a standards based lesson in HTML5 development that is relevant to the needs of students in the K-12 classroom and can scaffold instruction in HTML5 coding for a diverse range of learners.
1d9472c2-07f3-4193-b8f8-74b49e195345.name: Introduction to Coding in the Classrom

issuer.summary: issued by Stony Brook University School of Professional Development

entity.name: Stony Brook University School of Professional Development

badge_template_activities.title: Complete 3-week course introducing K-12 teachers to the HTML5 coding. Emphasis is placed on a differentiated approach to front-end website development that is standards based and discipline specific.
Create a prototype website project for curricular or co-curricular use with students.

48d3a775-987f-4bc1-b527-9212bed87acf.description: The holder of this badge has engaged in a series of coursework related to investment analysis. The holder understands investment strategies and portfolio management.
48d3a775-987f-4bc1-b527-9212bed87acf.name: Investment Analysis

issuer.summary: issued by Stony Brook University School of Professional Development

entity.name: Stony Brook University School of Professional Development

badge_template_activities.title: Earn at least a 3.0 GPA in FIN 539 Investment Analysis and FIN 525 Portfolio Management
Students who are not in the Finance AGC or MBA program need consent of the Finance program director to register.

8d69dda7-07aa-4793-b37e-9ef1a22c30f6.description: The holder of this badge has engaged in a series of coursework related to social entrepreneurship. The holder understands effective leadership, team development, and communication, and can effectively advocate for and market their entrepreneurial ventures. This badge is offered in coordination with the Stony Brook University College of Business.
8d69dda7-07aa-4793-b37e-9ef1a22c30f6.name: Social Entrepreneurship

issuer.summary: issued by Stony Brook University School of Professional Development

entity.name: Stony Brook University School of Professional Development

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the following courses with grades of at least B and a minimum GPA of 3.0: MBA 571/CES 549 Social Entrepreneurship; MBA 506/CES 547 Leadership, Team Effectiveness and Communications; CES 597 Advocacy and Marketing for Social Entrepreneurs.

2c06055d-352b-4fb7-a571-6dd545fad590.description: The holder of this badge has engaged in a series of coursework related to social media and digital classrooms. The holder can leverage social media in a virtual classroom and can incorporate badges and gamification into a flipped classroom experience.
2c06055d-352b-4fb7-a571-6dd545fad590.name: Social Media & The Flipped Classroom

issuer.summary: issued by Stony Brook University School of Professional Development

entity.name: Stony Brook University School of Professional Development

badge_template_activities.title: Earn at least a 3.0 GPA in the following courses: Social Media and the Digital Classroom (15 hours); Flipped Classroom, Badges and Gamification (15 hours); and Extending Learning Beyond Classroom Walls (15 hours).

b52e0781-cf22-4bb0-a2a1-2408a5ed625f.description: The holder of this badge has engaged in a series of coursework related to Spanish language awareness. The earner is familiar with the school's demographics and Spanish language activities and curricula.
b52e0781-cf22-4bb0-a2a1-2408a5ed625f.name: Spanish Language Awareness

issuer.summary: issued by Stony Brook University School of Professional Development

entity.name: Stony Brook University School of Professional Development

badge_template_activities.title: Earn at least a 3.0 GPA in Short Course I: The School and Its People (24 hours) and Short Course II: Activities and Curriculum (24 hours)

20e0fc66-a6ef-4158-a9a5-a5b76f9bd9ed.description: The holder of this badge has engaged in a series of coursework related to leadership as a teacher. The badge holder is prepared to lead among their peers and communities.
20e0fc66-a6ef-4158-a9a5-a5b76f9bd9ed.name: Teacher Leader

issuer.summary: issued by Stony Brook University School of Professional Development

entity.name: Stony Brook University School of Professional Development

badge_template_activities.title: Earn at least a 3.0 GPA in CEE 527 Peer Leadership in Teaching and CEF 554 Teachers as Leaders.

95afb17d-520d-4ca6-b9bf-adc557933d93.description: The holder of this badge has engaged in a series of coursework related to teaching students with special needs. The holder understands principles and best practices in special education and can develop an IEP to support students' individualized learning.
95afb17d-520d-4ca6-b9bf-adc557933d93.name: Teaching Students with Special Needs

issuer.summary: issued by Stony Brook University School of Professional Development

entity.name: Stony Brook University School of Professional Development

badge_template_activities.title: Earn at least a 3.0 GPA in 1) CEF 547 Principles and Practices in Special Education and 2) CEF 550 Special Education: Developing the Individual Education Plan (IEP)

Earn at least a 3.0 GPA in one of the following courses: CEE 581 Diverse Classroom/Culture Change, CEE 513 Teaching the At-Risk Student, CEB 586 Differentiated Instruction in Science and Math, or CEF 560 Differentiated Instruction

440a05b9-a8c6-4038-b8bc-632388e0f744.description: The holder of this badge has engaged in a series of coursework related to technology and social media. The holder is a technologically savvy administrator who can use social media to establish an intentional digital footprint and make meaningful digital connections.
440a05b9-a8c6-4038-b8bc-632388e0f744.name: Technology for Administrators

issuer.summary: issued by Stony Brook University School of Professional Development

entity.name: Stony Brook University School of Professional Development

badge_template_activities.title: Earn at least a 3.0 GPA in the following courses: Becoming Technology Savvy for Administrators (15 hours); Social Media and Digital Footprint for Administrators (15 hours); and Making Digital Connections for Administrators (15 hours).

79979382-bf08-4b5b-a929-ae373eafcfcc.description: The holder of this badge has engaged in a series of coursework related to understanding adolescence. The holder can anticipate and meet students' instructional needs in a time of students' rapid development.
79979382-bf08-4b5b-a929-ae373eafcfcc.name: Understanding Adolescence

issuer.summary: issued by Stony Brook University School of Professional Development

entity.name: Stony Brook University School of Professional Development

badge_template_activities.title: Earn at least a 3.0 GPA in the following courses: CEE 601 Early Adolescent Development, CEE 602 Middle Child Education: Instruction, and CEM 582 Problems of Adolescence.

10667604-aa60-4de3-9800-965fb110a947.description: The holder of this badge has engaged in a series of coursework related to understanding youth and character development. The holder can recognize and prevent violence and bullying, and can support at-risk students while fostering an inclusive and ethical learning environment.
10667604-aa60-4de3-9800-965fb110a947.name: Understanding Youth & Character

issuer.summary: issued by Stony Brook University School of Professional Development

entity.name: Stony Brook University School of Professional Development

badge_template_activities.title: Earn at least a 3.0 GPA in the following courses: CEI 558 Youth & Gang Violence, CEE 581 Diverse Classroom/Culture Change, CEE 513 Teaching the At-Risk Student, CEE 584 Preventing Bullying & Bias, CEE 504 Youth in Crisis, and CEE 571 Character Education: Ethics and Values.
